main event: An unidentified flying object was observed in Biloxi, Mississippi on 6 November 1957, by Lt. George Funk, USAF.
interesting points: The object was described as elliptical and approximately 40 feet in diameter., It was bright orange and hovered before accelerating rapidly out of sight., The sighting lasted about 2 minutes under clear weather conditions., The object was reported to be three times brighter than a star and brighter than any aircraft landing lights., The report concluded that the object could possibly be a balloon, meteor, or an astronomical phenomenon.
